newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong's Lily Wong cartoon revived in Britain.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong's Lily Wong cartoon revived in Britain.

text.p: Britain's Independent newspaper said on Friday it was reviving the popular Hong Kong cartoon character, Lily Wong, for a series that will run from March 24 until the colony is handed back to China on June 30.
The World of Lily Wong, in which cartoonist Larry Feign dealt in a light-hearted way with issues like human rights in China, was dropped by the South China Morning Post in May 1995.
The paper cited financial reasons but local commentators blamed self-censorship as the handover date loomed.
"The termination of the Lily Wong strip gained worldwide attention because it was seen as an indication of the Hong Kong media bowing to Chinese pressure," the Independent said in a statement.
Its move has apparently been welcomed by Hong Kong Governor Chris Patten.
"Like a lot of other people in Hong Kong, I used to follow the world of Lily Wong every day," it quoted Patten as saying.
"I really missed her when, for whatever reason, she suddenly disappeared from our lives about two years ago. I am glad to hear that she is making a comeback in Britain."
